content.raw:
The `/X*/odometry/filtered` rostopic seems to be outputting useless data. I flew the X3 & X4 out into space with the joystick and the rostopic odometry message said that position.x, position.y, and position.z were all still less than 1.0. 

The odometry rostopic for the UAVs from gazebo9 used to output reliable data.

Tested X4 with `ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X4 robotConfig1:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_2` and `rostopic echo /X4/odometry/filtered`

 Tested X3 with `ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X3 robotConfig1:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_3` and `rostopic echo /X3/odometry/filtered`
content.html:
The /X*/odometry/filtered rostopic seems to be outputting useless data. I flew the X3 & X4 out into space with the joystick and the rostopic odometry message said that position.x, position.y, and position.z were all still less than 1.0.

The odometry rostopic for the UAVs from gazebo9 used to output reliable data.

Tested X4 with ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X4 robotConfig1:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_2 and rostopic echo /X4/odometry/filtered

Tested X3 with ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X3 robotConfig1:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_3 and rostopic echo /X3/odometry/filtered
